resources.string: Tap the weather map to quickly find reflexes by situation. These tips do not replace a reliable newsletter or common sense in the field.

‚Ä¢ Avoid ridges, isolated trees, ridges, wet caves, water. ‚Ä¢ Discarding sticks and metal objects; Isolate yourself from the soil (sac, foam). ‚Ä¢ Flash-to-bang: < 30 seconds near danger. Go down to a low, unfloodable area._TOK0__ ‚Ä¢ Safety position: squat, jointed feet, on insulation. Don't lie down. .

‚Ä¢ Beware of ridges and corridors; avoid exposed lakes and bridges._TOK0__ ‚Ä¢ Anticipe unstable branches/rocks; space the group. ‚Ä¢ Fixed hood/equipment; lowers the center of gravity in the gusts. .
‚Ä¢ Hydrate early and often; useful salts/sweet water. ‚Ä¢ Slow down, multiplies breaks in shadow; cover neck/head. ‚Ä¢ Monitor cramps, headaches, confusion, stop & cool. .
‚Ä¢ Overlays layers; protects ends and wind._TOK0_ ‚Ä¢ Dry storage: changes a wet top; Isolate yourself from the ground. ‚Ä¢ Hypo: chills, awkwardness, slowness, warm sweetness, wet change. .

‚Ä¢ Reduce the appearance; remains grouped; visibility / cliff = prudence ++._TOK0__ ‚Ä¢ Orient yourself: compass, short azimuth, simple attack points. ‚Ä¢ Mark the path (waypoints), often check map/terrain. .

‚Ä¢ Avoids ravine bottoms in case of thunderstorm; flash raw attention._TOK0__ ‚Ä¢ Keep a breathable layer; protects what should not be wet. ‚Ä¢ Feet: anticipated slide (stone/wood) and prolonged cold. .
